title: Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering
bannerCon: Building strong academic foundations in electrical and electronics engineering through analysis, design, and research.

items.subTitle: Overview
items.contents: The Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering offers Bachelor of Engineering in Electrical and Electronics Engineering and Master of Engineering in Power Systems Engineering. Research programmes include Ph.D. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering. The research specializations of the department are Power Systems, High Voltage Engineering, Power Electronics and Drives, Control and Instrumentation, Embedded System Technology, Electric Drives and Embedded Control. The Department has well-equipped Machines, Power Electronics and Power System Laboratories and a team of dedicated faculty members with industry as well as academic experience.

items.subTitle: Vision
content: To evolve as a Centre of Excellence for Teaching–Learning and Research in Electrical and Electronics Engineering.

items.subTitle: Mission
content: Providing quality education through state-of-the-art laboratories, innovative and value-based teaching methodologies.
Establishing a Centre of Excellence in prominent areas of Electrical and Electronics Engineering and supporting faculty members and students to actualize interdisciplinary research.
Facilitating Institute–Industry interaction for content delivery, curriculum development, and research projects.

content.title: BE Electrical and Electronics Engineering – FT
BE Electrical and Electronics Engineering – PT

basic.title: Faculty
basic.description: The faculty of the Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering focuses on power systems, control technologies, and intelligent electrical applications. Through hands-on experimentation, system-level problem solving, and technology-driven instruction, the faculty prepares students for advancements in energy, automation, and smart electrical systems.

breadcrumbItems.label: Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering

items.title: Laboratories
items.desc: The department of EEE has a complete range of dedicated laboratories with newest equipment for teaching and research. Laboratories provide an environment for students to reinforce their understanding of the fundamental principles of Electrical and Electronics Engineering and apply their knowledge through hands-on learning using current technology. The following are the laboratories in this department.

items.title: Department Library
content: The department library has a total of 150 books in various electrical and electronics streams.
Project reports done by final year students are stacked in the department library for student’s reference.

items.title: Skill Development Center
content: LED Tube Light Assembly and Testing

contentList: 9th National Conference on “Clean and Green Energy” (NCCGE’26) on 27.02.2026 through hybrid mode (Offline and Online)

7th National Conference of Clean and Green Energy’2024 (NCCGE’2024) on February 10, 2024. Dr. Ravi Samikannu, an esteemed Associate Professor from the Faculty of Engineering and Technology at the Botswana International University of Science and Technology, Botswana, delivered the keynote session on “Smart Grid Technologies and Challenges,” offering a thorough exploration of the field’s latest developments and potential obstacles.
6th National Conference of Clean and Green Energy 2022 on 21st December 2022. Dr.P.Anbalagan Head Department of EEE, Anna University, BIT Campus, Tiruchirappalli, delivered keynote address.
5th National Conference on Clean and Green Energy 2022 on 18th Feb 2022. Dr. P. Vijayarajan M.E., Ph.D.Associate Professor, EEE, Anna University, BIT Campus, Trichy, delivered keynote address.

3rd National Conference on Clean and Green Energy 2020 on 29th Feb 2020. Dr. J. Devi Shree M.E., Ph.D., Associate Professor, Department of Electrical Electronics Engineering, Coimbatore Institute of Technology, Avinashi Road, Coimbatore. delivered keynote address.

The Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering hosted the National Level Technical Fest “Electtricco 2k24” on 8th February, 2024. Er. M. RanjithKumar, M.E., (PhD), Training Officer and Superintending Engineer at PSG Institutions, served as the keynote speaker, delivering a speech on emerging technologies in electrical engineering. Additionally, Ms. P. Nagaveni conducted a workshop on Power Quality Measurement in Electrical Systems using Fluke Meter. A total of 127 students from over 20 colleges registered for both online and offline participation. Four technical events were coordinated.

The Department of EEE has organized “National Level Technical Symposium – “Electtricco 2k23” on 10th Feb 2023. Conducted various technical and non technical events like Paper Presentation, Project Presentation, Technical Quiz, Photography, Circuit debugging, Connections and Best Manager. More than 500 participants were participated from various colleges and won the prizes. Er. S. Jawahar, Superintending Engineer, TANGEDCO and Er. KRN Manoj, Director - Operations, M/s. Pumo Technovation India Pvt Ltd, Coimbatore were the Chief Guest and Resource person of the event.

Department of EEE has organized Six days online Professional Development Program on “Emerging Trends in Electrical Engineering” from 20th Nov to 25th Nov 2023. Emerging technologies in electrical engineering involve advancements in battery technologies, supercapacitors, and even innovative solutions like gravity-based energy storage. The top electrical trends for 2023 are expected to be focused on sustainability and energy efficiency. With the increasing concern for climate change, there will be a greater emphasis on renewable energy sources such as solar and wind power. This PDP helps in understanding the technologies, latest trends and innovations in electrical engineering and their potential impact on the industry and society.
